alert.note: Alert for Allen; Simpson; Warren (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 05 at 4:42PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Simpson, northwestern Allen and southern Warren Counties through 415 PM CDT... At 342 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Memphis Junction, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Memphis Junction around 345 PM CDT. Crestmoor around 350 PM CDT. Mount Victor around 355 PM CDT. Plum Springs around 400 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Bowling Green. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for south central Kentucky.
